subject: Management
title: The Cost of Silence
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Cost of Silence usable.

hook.text: A manager waited six months to address a performance issue. By then, the entire team had suffered.

buildup.text: Withholding feedback feels kind. In reality, it's selfish‚Äîit protects your comfort, not their growth.

discovery.text: Kim Scott calls it ruinous empathy: being so nice that you fail to be honest.

twist.text: The person struggling would have wanted to know months ago. Silence stole their chance to improve.

climax.text: If you care about someone, tell them the truth. Caring and honesty aren't opposites.

punchline.text: Silence isn't kindness. It's a slow betrayal.

quiz.question: What is ruinous empathy in the context of feedback?
options: Being so nice that you avoid honest feedback that could help someone grow
Being too harsh and direct when giving performance reviews
Feeling empathy for someone while giving constructive feedback
